Executive Summary for Corsicana Technolgies, Inc., Corsicana Plant

1.  Accidental Release Prevention and Emergency Response Policies
The Corsicana Technolgies, Inc.,Corsicana Plant, has always had a strong commitment to its employees to provide a safe working envrionment. This policy is consistent with both the spirit and the intent of our commitment.  The safety of employees, company operations, and the public are mangement's most important complete compliance with all safety regulations and safety policies.

Every attempt will be made to reduce the possibility of accident occurrence by all levels of mangement.  Corsicana belives that safety, like quality and housekeeping, can be controlled by motivated supervision.  Therefore, preventable lost time accidents will have an impact on a supervisor's annual salary review, including any bonuses and incentive plans.  Unreported accidents will be considered falsification of company records and will result in immediate discharge.  Lost time accident free locations will be eligible for annual awards.

2.  The Station Source and the Regulated Substances Handled
Corsicana operates a specialty chemcial plant, and manufacturers fatty amines and nitrile intermediates.  The principal prducts are emulsifiers, corrosion inhibitors, de-emulsifiers, and surfactants.

We have seven regulated substances present at our facility as raw materials for processes, which include dimethylamine (DMA), acrylonitrile, anhydrous ammonia, hydrogen, formaldehyde, methyl chloride (MeCl), and trimethylamine (TMA).  Acrylonitrile, anhydrous ammonia, formaldehyde, and methyl chloride are regulated as toxic chemicals and trimethylamine, hydrogen, and dimethylamine ar regulated as flammable chemicals.

 
3.  The General Accidental Release Prevention Program and the Chemical-Specific Prevention Steps
Our facility has taken all the necessary steps to comply with the accidental release prevention requirements set out under 40 Code of Federal Regulations Par

Pre-startup Reviews
Pre-startup safety reviews related to new processes and to modification in established processes will be conducted as a regular practice at Corsicana.  These reviews are conducted to confirm that construction and equipment is in accordance with design specifications, and safety, operating, maintenance, and emergency procedures are suitable for safe startup prior to placing equipment into operation.

Compliance Audits
Corsicana coddcucts audits on a regular basis to determine whether the provisions set out under the RMP rule are being implemented.  These audits are carried out by at least one person knowledgeable in the process and are conducted at least every 3 years.  Audit findings are documented in a report.  Any corrective actions rquired as a result of the audits are undetaken in a safe and prompt manner and are also documented.  The facility will maintain the two most recent compliance audit reports.

Incidient Investigation
Corsicana promplty investigates any incident that has resulted in, or could reasonably results in a catastrophic release of a regulated substance.  An incident investigation will be initiated as promptly as posssible, but not later than 48 hours after the incident, and will involve at least one person knowledgeable of the process involved.  These investigation are undertaken to identify the situation leading to the incident as well as any corrective actions to prevent the release from reoccurring.  A report will be prepared at the conclusion of the investigation and will included any resolutions and corrective action.  All reports are retained for a minimum of  5 years.

Employee Participation
Corsicana believes that PSM and accidental prevention are a team effort.  Company employees are strongly encouraged to express their views concerning accident prevention issues and to recommend improvements.  In addition, our empoye

t 68 of the EPA.  This facility was designed and constructed in accordance with ASME B31.3.  A number of processes at our faciity are subject to the Occupatonal Safety and Health Adminstrtioan (OSHA) Processes Safety Management (PSM) standard under 29 CFR 1910.119.  The following section briefly describe the elements of the release prevention program that is in place at our stationary source.

Process Safety Information
Corsicana maintains a detailed record of process safety information that describes the hazards of regulated substances, operating parameters and equipment designs associated with all processes.  Much of the information was compiled during the preparation of the Process Hazard Analysis (PHA).  Chemical-specific information, including exposure hazards and emergency response/exposure treatment considerations, is provided in material safety data sheets (MSDSs).

Process Hazard Analysis
Our facility conduct comprehensive studies to ensure that hazards associated with our processes are identified and controlled efficiently. Corsicana primarily uses the checklist and HAZOP method analysis techniques to perform these evaluations. The studies were undertaken by a team of qualified personnel with expertise in engineering and process operations and will be revalidated at regular intervals.  Any findings related to the hazard analysis are addressed in a timely manner.

For the purposes of safety conducting activiites within our covered processes, Corsicana maintains written operating procedures that provide clear instructions for safely conducting activities involved in each covered process consistent with the process safety.  These procedures address various modes of operation such as initial startup, normal operations, temporary operations, emergency shutdown, emergency oeprations, normal shutdown and startup after a turnaround.  The information is regularly reviewed and is readily accessible to operators involved in the processes.

Corsicana develops and impl

ements safety work practices to provide for the control of hazards during operations such as lockout/tagout/confined space entry; opening process equipment or piping; and control over entrance into stationary source by maintenance, contractor, laboratory, or other support personnel.  These safe work practices apply to employees and contractor employees.

Training
Corsicana has a training program in place to ensure that employees who are operating processses are competent in the operating procedures associated with these processes.  Initital training of operators is provided, and refresher training is provided as required.  Both initial and refresher training is documented and records of training are maintained onsite for at least 3 years.

Mechanical Itegrity
Corsicana has written procedures for maintaining on-going integrity of process equipment, which incorporates training for process maintenance activities, inspection and testing, corrective action for equipment deficieinces and the application of quality assurance measures.  Corsicana carries out documetned maintenaince checks on process equipment to ensure proper installation and operaitons.  Process equipment examined by these checks incldueds among others: pressure vessels, storage tanks, piping systems, relief and vent systems, emergency shutdown systems, control and pumps.  Maintenance operations are carried out by qualifeid and trained pesonnel.  Any equipment deficiencies identified by the maintenance checks are corrected in a safe and timely manner.  The plant also incorporates quality assurance measures to ensure that euqipment and parts are suitable for the process application for which they wll be used.

Management of Change
Written procedures are in place at Corsicana to manage changes in process chemicals, technology, equipment and procedures.  These procedures will be updated as needed.  Process operators, maintenance personnel or any other employee whose job tasks are affected by a modification in

es have access to all information created as part of the faclity's implementation of the RMP rule, including information resulting from process hazard anayses in particular.

Hot Work Permit
Corsicana will issue a hot work permit for hot work operations conducted on or near a covered process.   Permit shall document that the fire prevention and protection requirements have been implemented prior to beginning the hot work operations; it shall indicate the date(s) authorized for hot work; and identify the object on which hot work is to be perforemd.  The permit will be kept on file until completion of the hot work operations.

Contractors
Corsicana hires contractors to conduct specialized maintenance and construction activities.  Prior to selecting a contractor, a thorough evaluation of safety perfomance of the contractor is carried out.  Before any contractors are allowed to work at Corsicana, they undergo an orientation conducted by the PSM team.  During this orientation contractors are made aware of the known potential hazards related the contractor's work, the hazards of regulated substances within Corsicana, the safe work procedures insisted on by Corsicana, and familiarized with the Hot Work Permit Policy and the Lock Out/Tag Out procedures used at Corsicana.  Contractor are informed of all the procedures for emergency response should an accidental release of a regulated  substance occur, and this information includes evacuation routes and assembly points.  Corsicana willl document that the contractor has received and understands the training.

Chemical Specific Prevention Steps
The processes at Corsicana  have hazards that must be managed to ensure continued safe operations.  Section 7 of the RMP describes existing safety features applicable to prevention of accidental releases of regulated substances at the facility.  The accident prevention program summarized previously is applied to all RMP-regulated processes at Corsicana.  Collectively, these prevention pr

ogram activities help prevent potential accidental scenarios that could be caused by equipment failures and human error.

4.  Five-year Accident History
The faclitly has not expereinced any reportable accidents in th past 5 years.

5.  Emergency Response Program
Corsicana has a written emergency response plan to deal with accidental releases of hazardous material, which in in place to protect workers and public safety, and the envrionment.  The plan includes all aspects of emergency response including adequate first aid and medical treatment, evacuation, notification of local emergency response agencies and the public, as well as post-incident decontamination of affected areas.  Employees receive training in emergency procedures.  To ensure proper functioning, emergency response equipment is regularly inspected and serviced.  In addition, the plan is promplty updated to reflect any pertinent changes taking place within processes that would require a modified emergency response.  The emergency plan has been coordinated with and verified by the Navarro County the Local Emegency Planning Committee (LEPC).

At all times there must be at least one employee either on the facility premises or on-call (i.e. available to respond to an emrgency by reaching the facility within a short period of time) with the responsibility for coordination all emergency response measures.  This emergency coordinator will be thoroughly familiar with all aspects of the facility's emergency response plan, all operations and activities at the facility, the location and characteristics of material/waste handled, the location of all records within the facility, and the facility layout.  In addition, this person will have the authority to commit the resources needed to carry out the emergency response plan.

6.  Planned Changes to Improve Safety
Corsicana will continue to  improve safety at the facilty through training.  No other upcoing events are planned to improve safety at this time.
